resource.chars:
Continuing in this dangerous condition he was 
put to bed as soon as one could be got ready 
for him, where his arm was again bathed with 
his Remedy over a pan of charcoal set by the 
Bed side, but continuing complain much of his 
Back & belly I advised his wife to rubb <s>his<\s> them 
likewise with <s>ye same Remedy <\s> sallad oil heated in a Ladle 
over ye charcoal, <u>wch <\u> she did accordingly, where 
upon he declared he found immediate Ease as 
tho’ by some charm, & he had not above 2 or 3 
Reachings to vomit & stools afterwards, but made 
Water plentifully, <u>wch <\u> was not discolour’d: then he 
soon fell into a sound sleep, only was often inter-
rupted by persons coming to see & enquire after him 
till near 12 a clock from <u>wch <\u> time he slept continually 
to 5 or 6 next morning, when he awaked & 
found himself very well: But in ye afternoon on 
drinking some Rum & strong Beer so as to be almost 
fuddled, the swelling return’d with much pain, &
cold sweats, <u>wch <\u> abated soon on bathing the 
Arm as before & wrapping it up in brown paper 
soaked with <s>ye Remedy <\S> oil.
Two Pidgeons were bit by ye same viper imediate 
ly after ye Man: they soon sicken’d & seem’d giddy
nothing being applyed the one dyed in about an
